title: Apple execs spotted in New Orleans ahead of Super Bowl
description: If you urgently need to get ahold of Apple CEO Tim Cook or one of the other senior Apple executives this weekend, you'll need to head to New Orleans and the Caesars Superdome.Logo for the 2025 Super BowlSuper Bowl LIX will be played in New Orleans on Sunday, February 9, and several of Apple's top brass have been spotted in the city ahead of the big event. CEO Tim Cook, retail chief Deirdre O'Brien, and Apple Services head Eddy Cue are among the execs seen so far.Cook and O'Brien also dropped by the Apple Lakeside Shopping Center in Metairie, surprising employees there. Cue, Cook, and O'Brien were sighted at Domilise's Po-Boys & Bar on Annunciation Street in the downtown area. Continue Reading on AppleInsider | Discuss on our Forums
author: Charles Martin
excerpt: If you urgently need to get ahold of Apple CEO Tim Cook or one of the other senior Apple executives this weekend, you'll need to head to New Orleans and the Caesars Superdome.
text: If you urgently need to get ahold of Apple CEO Tim Cook or one of the other senior Apple executives this weekend, you'll need to head to New Orleans and the Caesars Superdome. Super Bowl LIX will be played in New Orleans on Sunday, February 9, and several of Apple's top brass have been spotted in the city ahead of the big event. CEO Tim Cook, retail chief Deirdre O'Brien, and Apple Services head Eddy Cue are among the execs seen so far. Cook and O'Brien also dropped by the Apple Lakeside Shopping Center in Metairie, surprising employees there. Cue, Cook, and O'Brien were sighted at Domilise's Po-Boys & Bar on Annunciation Street in the downtown area. Outside of Apple, fans of musician Taylor Swift will want to keep an eye out for the pop superstar in the stadium and possibly elsewhere, as her beau Travis Kelce will be playing tight end during the game. Cook was also spotted having a meal with former Miami Dolphins player Odell Beckham Jr. at Domilise's, reports 9to5Mac. Apple users can watch the game for free in 4K on any recent Apple computer, phone, iPad, or Apple Vision Pro, as well as through the Apple TV device.
html:
If you urgently need to get ahold of Apple CEO Tim Cook or one of the other senior Apple executives this weekend, you'll need to head to New Orleans and the Caesars Superdome.

Super Bowl LIX will be played in New Orleans on Sunday, February 9, and several of Apple's top brass have been spotted in the city ahead of the big event. CEO Tim Cook, retail chief Deirdre O'Brien, and Apple Services head Eddy Cue are among the execs seen so far.

Cook and O'Brien also dropped by the Apple Lakeside Shopping Center in Metairie, surprising employees there. Cue, Cook, and O'Brien were sighted at Domilise's Po-Boys & Bar on Annunciation Street in the downtown area.

Outside of Apple, fans of musician Taylor Swift will want to keep an eye out for the pop superstar in the stadium and possibly elsewhere, as her beau Travis Kelce will be playing tight end during the game. Cook was also spotted having a meal with former Miami Dolphins player Odell Beckham Jr. at Domilise's, reports 9to5Mac.

Apple users can watch the game for free in 4K on any recent Apple computer, phone, iPad, or Apple Vision Pro, as well as through the Apple TV device.
